page.title: 05TRANSPORT
page.content: { If we stand on Elizabeth Way, the road running along the north side of the town through Little Parndon, and look north across our area we can see the valley of the Stort, the railway and the A 414 road which connects Hertford and Chelmsford. The Stort was unnavigable until it was converted into a canal with a series of locks, so that it was possible to sail from Broxbourne to Bishop's Stortford. The canal was opened in 1769 and is now run by the Stort Navigation Company. When it was opened a number of malting and brewing establishments grew up alongside the canal. Nowadays most of the boats are pleasure craft.
